headline: Herschel Walker responds to Elie Mystal's attack: Democratic Party 'has left Brown and Black people behind'
sentences:
LEGAL CORRESPONDENT DOUBLES DOWN ON CLAIM US CONSTITUTION IS 'ACTUALLY TRASH'
Walker vowed not to be bullied by Mystal, saying he was bullied as a child and words will not hurt him.
"  [W]hat's strange about it is he's not telling everyone that the Democratic Party has left Brown and Black people behind," Walker told host Sean Hannity.
Georgia U.S. Senate candidate Herschel Walker asserted that the Democratic Party "has left Brown and Black people behind" Thursday on "Hannity."
The Senate candidate also reacted to his dismissal from the President's Council on Sports, Fitness and Nutrition, saying it will not stop him.
"They forgot all about us, and they not just forgot about us, you look at the policy that's going on, which has nothing to do with color."
Walker promised to fight for children, explaining that he wanted to help children with a weight problem while on the council.
Walker responded to a column from Elie Mystal entitled, "The Herschel Walker Senate Campaign Is an Insult to Black People."
"What it has to do with is these policies are not suitable for the people of Georgia.
He is "about bringing people together, not separating people," he explained.
"What it seems like you are [doing] is to separate people because of color.
He added that he does not believe that "men should be in women's sports."
He then invited the writer to visit Georgia to "break bread" with him.
They're not suitable for the people of the United States of America."
I know that, and I'm going to fight for the women as well."
"  [T]he definition of a woman is written in the Bible.
Mystal called the campaign "a political minstrel show."
